solution_line_template: Jacob can eat {nellie_candies} / {jacob_divisor} = <<{nellie_candies}/{jacob_divisor}={jacob_candies}>>{jacob_candies} candies before crying.
Lana can eat {jacob_candies} - {lana_difference} = <<{jacob_candies}-{lana_difference}={lana_candies}>>{lana_candies} candies before crying.

Nellie, Jacob, and Lana all ate until they cried, so they ate {nellie_candies} + {jacob_candies} + {lana_candies} = <<{nellie_candies}+{jacob_candies}+{lana_candies}={total_eaten}>>{total_eaten} candies.
Thus, there are {initial_bucket} - {total_eaten} = <<{initial_bucket}-{total_eaten}={candies_left}>>{candies_left} candies left in the bucket.
After dividing the remaining candies equally, they will each get {candies_left} / {people} = <<{candies_left}/{people}={candies_per_person}>>{candies_per_person} sourball candies.
